cards.name: Turtwig
cards.text: The shell on its back is made of soil. On a very healthy Turtwig, the shell should feel moist.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Grotle
cards.text: It knows where pure water wells up. It carries fellow Pokémon there on its back.

attacks.name: Knock Away
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Torterra
cards.text: Some Pokémon are born on a Torterra's back and spend their entire life there.

attacks.name: Guard Press
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Rumble Stomp
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Combee
cards.text: This Pokémon is a set of three. When they sleep, they gather up and form a giant hive of 100 Combee.

attacks.name: Sting Missile
attacks.text: Shuffle this Pokémon and all cards attached to it into your deck.

cards.name: Vespiquen
cards.text: It houses its colony in cells in its body and releases various pheromones to make those grubs do its bidding.

attacks.name: Gather Order
attacks.text: Search your deck for as many Combee as you like and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Damage Beat
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Cherubi
cards.text: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.

attacks.name: Leech Seed
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cherrim

abilities.name: Fair-Weather Heal
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may heal 20 damage from 1 of your Pokémon that has any Grass Energy attached to it.

cards.text: If it senses strong sunlight, it opens its folded petals to absorb the sun's rays with its whole body.

attacks.name: Random Peck
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Sewaddle
cards.text: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

cards.name: Swadloon
cards.text: Preferring dark, damp places, it spends the entire day eating fallen leaves that lie around it.

attacks.name: Swaddle Guard
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 40 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Leavanny
cards.text: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves by using the sticky silk secreted from its mouth.

attacks.name: Cleave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Maractus
cards.text: When it moves rhythmically, it makes a sound similar to maracas, making the surprised Pokémon flee.

attacks.name: Dazzle Dance
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Ambush
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Foongus
cards.text: It lures Pokémon with its pattern that looks just like a Poké Ball then releases poison spores.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

cards.name: Amoonguss
cards.text: It moves the caps on both arms and does a dance to lure prey. It prefers damp places.

attacks.name: Astonish
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a random card from your opponent's hand. Your opponent reveals that card and shuffles it into his or her deck.

attacks.name: Miracle Powder
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, choose a Special Condition. The Defending Pokémon is now affected by that Special Condition.

cards.name: Moltres-EX

attacks.name: Destructive Flame
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Power Flame
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Chimchar
cards.text: It is very agile. Before going to sleep, it extinguishes the flame on its tail to prevent fires.

cards.name: Monferno
cards.text: It skillfully controls the intensity of the fire on its tail to keep its foes at an ideal distance.

attacks.name: Loud Howl

attacks.name: Fire Tail Slap
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Infernape
cards.text: It uses unique fighting moves with fire on its hand and feet. It will take on any opponent.

attacks.name: Torment
attacks.text: Choose 1 of the Defending Pokémon's attack. That Pokémon can't use that attack during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Malevolent Fire
attacks.text: Discard all Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Pansear
cards.text: Very intelligent, it roasts berries before eating them. It likes to help people.

attacks.name: Double Fire
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Simisear

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Flame Blast
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Litwick
cards.text: Its flame is usually out, but it starts shining when it absorbs life force from people or Pokémon.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Lampent

abilities.name: Freefloating
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has no Energy attached to it, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: The spirits it absorbs fuel its baleful fire. It hangs around hospitals waiting for people to pass on.

cards.name: Heatmor
cards.text: It draws in air through its tail, transforms it into fire, and uses it like a tongue. It melts Durant and eats them.

attacks.name: Luring Flame
attacks.text: Switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon. The new Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fiery Licks
attacks.text: Discard the top 4 cards of your deck. This attack does 50 damage times the number of Fire Energy cards discarded.

cards.name: Squirtle

cards.name: Articuno-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frost Prison

cards.name: Swinub
cards.text: Rooting the tip of its snout into the ground, it searches for food. Sometimes, it even digs up a hot spring.

attacks.name: Double Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Piloswine

attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 90 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Lombre
cards.text: It has a mischievous spirit. If it spots an angler, it will tug on the fishing line to interfere.

abilities.name: Rain Dish

cards.text: If it hears festive music, all its muscles fill with energy. It can't help breaking out into a dance.

attacks.name: Groovy Dance
attacks.text: You may discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you do, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.text: They swarm any foe that invades their territory. Their sharp fangs can tear out boat hulls.

cards.text: It is born with a wondrous power that lets it bond with any kind of Pokémon.

attacks.name: Seafaring
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. For each heads, attach a Water Energy card from your discard pile to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Vanillite
cards.text: Theoretically, this Pokémon formed from icicles bathed in energy from the morning sun. Their breath is -58° F.

attacks.name: Snow Squall
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Resistance.

cards.name: Vanillish
cards.text: They cool down the surrounding air and create ice particles, which they use to freeze their foes.

attacks.text: Attach 2 basic Energy cards from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blizzard

attacks.name: Absorb

abilities.name: Spiteful Spirit

attacks.name: White Inferno
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Clefairy
cards.text: On nights with a full moon, Clefairy gather from all over and dance. Bathing in moonlight makes them float.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Clefable

abilities.name: Moon Guidance
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for a card that evolves from 1 of your Pokémon and put it onto that Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.text: Their ears are sensitive enough to hear a pin drop from over a mile away, so they're usually found in quiet places.

cards.name: Doduo
cards.text: The brains in its two heads appear to communicate emotions to each other with telepathic power.

attacks.name: Gatling Peck
attacks.text: Flip 5 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Dodrio
cards.text: When Doduo evolves into this odd breed, one of its heads splits into two. It runs at nearly 40 mph.

attacks.name: Raging Pecks
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads. This Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Snorlax

abilities.name: Block
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent's Active Pokémon can't retreat.

cards.text: When its belly is full, it becomes too lethargic to even lift a finger, so it is safe to bounce on its belly.

attacks.name: Teampact
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of Team Plasma Pokémon you have in play.

cards.name: Togepi
cards.text: It transforms the kindness and joy of others into happiness, which it stores in its shell.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Togetic
cards.text: To share its happiness, it flies around the world seeking kind-hearted people.

attacks.name: Sweet Kiss
attacks.text: Your opponent draws a card.

cards.name: Togekiss

abilities.name: Bright Veil
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, whenever your opponent plays an Item card from his or her hand, prevent all effects of that card done to your Pokémon.

cards.text: It shares many blessings with people who respect one another's rights and avoid needless strife.

attacks.name: Return
attacks.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.

cards.name: Whismur
cards.text: Usually, its cries are like quiet murmurs. If frightened, it shrieks at the same volume as a jet plane.

attacks.name: Shout
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Loudred
cards.text: The shock waves from its cries can tip over trucks. It stamps its feet to power up.

attacks.name: Supersonic
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Exploud
cards.text: Its howls can be heard over six miles away. It emits all sorts of noises from the ports on its body.

attacks.name: Destructive Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent reveals his or her hand. Discard all Item cards you find there.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 50 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

cards.name: Lugia-EX

abilities.name: Overflow
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Plasma Gale
attacks.text: Discard a Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you can't discard a Plasma Energy, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Skitty
cards.text: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Triple Slap
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Patrat
cards.text: Extremely cautious, one of them will always be on the lookout, but it won't notice a foe coming from behind.

attacks.name: Reckless Charge
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Patrat
cards.text: Extremely cautious, there is always one keeping watch, but they don't notice enemies coming from behind.

attacks.name: Collect
attacks.text: Draw a card.

attacks.name: Slam
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Watchog
cards.text: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

attacks.name: Fast Swipe
attacks.text: Discard a random card from your opponent's hand.

attacks.name: Biting Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Watchog
cards.text: Using luminescent matter, it makes its eyes and body glow and stuns attacking opponents.

attacks.name: Second Bite
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Bouffalant
cards.text: They are known to charge so wildly that if a train were to enter their territory, they would send it flying.

attacks.name: Tool Breaker
attacks.text: Discard a Pokémon Tool card attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Rufflet
cards.text: It stands up to massive opponents, not out of courage, but out of recklessness. But that is how it gets stronger.

attacks.name: Incessant Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Braviary

abilities.name: Big Wing
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, you may have your opponent switch his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon.

cards.text: The more scars they have, the more respect these brave soldiers of the sky get from their peers.

attacks.name: Wild Edge
attacks.text: You may do 20 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Bicycle
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 4 cards in your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Colress
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Colress Machine
cards.text: Search your deck for a Plasma Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Team Plasma Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Escape Rope
cards.text: Each player switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. (Your opponent switches first. If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, he or she doesn't switch Pokémon.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Ether
cards.text: Reveal the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. If it is not a basic Energy card, return it to the top of your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Eviolite
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If the Pokémon this card is attached to is a Basic Pokémon, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Hypnotoxic Laser
cards.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Poisoned. Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is also Asleep.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Plasma Frigate
cards.text: Each Pokémon that has any Plasma Energy attached to it (both yours and your opponent's) has no Weakness.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Team Plasma Grunt
cards.text: Discard a Team Plasma card from your card. (if you can't discard a Team Plasma card, you can't play this card.) Draw 4 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Virbank City Gym
cards.text: Put 2 more damage counters on Poisoned Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's) between turns.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Plasma Energy
cards.text: This card provides Colorless Energy.

cards.name: Dowsing Machine
cards.text: Discard 2 cards from your hand. (If you can't discard 2 cards, you can't play this card.) Put a Trainer card from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Scramble Switch
cards.text: Switch your Active Pokémon with 1 of your Benched Pokémon. Then, you may move as many Energy attached to the old Active Pokémon to the new Active Pokémon as you like.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Victory Piece
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,If this card is attached to Victini-EX, Victini-EX can use its attacks regardless of the amount or type of Energy attached to it.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).,You can't have more than 1 ACE SPEC card in your deck.

cards.name: Victini-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Energize
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Articuno-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Blizzard
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Frost Prison
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Plasma Energy attached to it, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Cobalion-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Righteous Edge
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Steel Bullet
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by Weakness, Resistance, or any other effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Lugia-EX

abilities.name: Overflow
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Plasma Gale
attacks.text: Discard a Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you can't discard a Plasma Energy, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Colress
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's).,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Charizard
cards.text: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Scorching Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Blastoise

abilities.name: Deluge
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Water Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: This extremely rare Pokémon is a different color than usual. It is very hard to find.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Random Receiver
cards.text: Reveal cards from the top of your deck until you reveal a Supporter card. Put it into your hand. Shuffle the other cards back into your deck.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).
